intro: Cohnia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered cohnia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid to semi-arid environments. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Cohnia parviflora is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
